Articles.Content: Hello everyone! Long time lurker, first time poster  I have been playing KSP for over a year and love it so far. My biggest accomplishments are a simultaneous 3-lander mission to Duna in order to visit anomalies and refuel using a refueling station on the low orbit before departing the duna system (the landers didn't have enough deltav to come back to the kerbin system). Looking forward to participating in the forums!

Hello WobblyRocketMaster and welcome to the forum!

Come in from the cold, lurker.  Looking forward to your participation.

Happy landings!
That sounds like a neat approach. Did your landers board a big bus to come home, or did they all make their way back under their own power after refueling?
Hey @Perry Apsis! Each of the landers came back on their own after refueling. It was a fun mission. Perhaps my favourite one so far. Cheers!

That's very different from my normal approach. Usually by the time my lander makes it back into orbit, there isn't much left of it. I've done missions where multiple landers all dock with a single transfer vehicle to take them home, but nowadays I mostly just spend a few minutes moving Kerbals, science, and any leftover fuel to the transfer ship and leaving just enough fuel in the lander to crash it into the surface.
